Content:
Disclaimer: Before one says "do a search" I did; "oil" sorted by date and went back approximately 3 years.
Proof of my search: 😇


I did not see an oil thread like this one. 😁
Assuming that we use motorcycle oil, do we use full synthetic or dino?
If you have more than one motorcycle, vote your majority use.

If you have put lots (<--subjective) of miles on a motorcycle(s) using either type of motorcycle oil with or without incident, such information is welcome.

I run full synthetic in my cars and plan on doing the same in my motorcycles.

ETA: I thought after I made this thread that some motorcycles may be able to run on oil made for cars, like if they don't have a "wet" clutch (example). I'd change the last poll option to reflect that but I can't edit the poll. So, please excuse wording of that poll option to a moment of stupidity. Thanks.

Title: Motorcycle oil, full synthetic or dino. What do you use?
Author: CDW4ME
